Package nusri.fyp.demo.service

Class VideoService

java.lang.Object
nusri.fyp.demo.service.VideoService
@Service public class VideoService extends Object
Service class for handling video uploads, processing video frames, and interacting with the state machine.
This class provides functionalities to:
  • Upload and save video files.
  • Process uploaded videos by sending frames for recognition.
  • Manage recognition results and integrate them with a StateMachine.
  • Handle single-frame (image) processing for real-time recognition updates.

This service works in close association with:
- ConfigService for retrieving model configurations and file paths.
- ImageSenderServiceImplOfPython and ImageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow for frame/image processing.
- StateMachineService for integrating recognition results into the state machine.
- RoboflowWorkflowRepository for retrieving workflow IDs in a Roboflow environment.

See Also:
  • ConfigService
  • StateMachineService
  • ImageSenderService
  • ImageSenderServiceImplOfPython
  • ImageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow
  • RoboflowWorkflowRepository

  • Constructor Details

    • VideoService

      public VideoService(ConfigService configService, ImageSenderServiceImplOfPython imageSenderServiceImplOfPython, ImageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow imageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow, StateMachineService stateMachineService, RoboflowWorkflowRepository roboflowWorkflowRepository)
      Constructs the VideoService with the required dependencies for video processing.
      These dependencies include ConfigService, two different implementations of ImageSenderService, the StateMachineService, and the RoboflowWorkflowRepository.
      Parameters:
      configService - the configuration service for retrieving file paths and model info
      imageSenderServiceImplOfPython - the Python-based implementation of image sending
      imageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow - the Roboflow-based implementation of image sending
      stateMachineService - the service for managing state machines
      roboflowWorkflowRepository - the repository for Roboflow workflow data
      See Also:
      • ConfigService
      • ImageSenderServiceImplOfPython
      • ImageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow
      • StateMachineService

  • Method Details

    • processVideo

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<? extends Serializable> processVideo(String user, String presetName)
      Processes an uploaded video by sending frames to the selected model for recognition.
      The frames are retrieved from a temporary file maintained by the relevant ImageSenderService.
      The results are stored as observations in the StateMachine corresponding to the given user and preset.
      The method spawns a separate thread to handle the frame-by-frame processing:
      • The observations are stored in an AtomicReference.
      • The thread is then joined to ensure processing completes before returning.
      • The observations are attached to the user's StateMachine instance.
      Parameters:
      user - the user identifier, used to distinguish different users' sessions
      presetName - the preset name corresponding to the desired model/preset configuration
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the resulting observations or an error message in case of failure
      See Also:
      • buildSenderService(String)
      • buildConfig(String)
      • StateMachineService.getStateMachineByName(String)

    • uploadAndSave

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> uploadAndSave(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile videoFile, String user) throws IOException
      Uploads and saves a video file to a designated path, then resets the relevant services.
      The user's existing StateMachine (if any) is stopped, and all ongoing image-sending processes are interrupted.
      The video file is saved under a fixed name in the configured location, using the user identifier.
      Parameters:
      videoFile - the uploaded MultipartFile containing video data
      user - the user identifier
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity representing the outcome of the save operation
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during file handling
      See Also:
      • isValidFilename(String)

    • isValidFilename

      public static boolean isValidFilename(String name)
      Validates the given filename to ensure it does not contain invalid characters or reserved names.
      This is important particularly on Windows-based systems with specific filename constraints.
      Parameters:
      name - the filename to validate
      Returns:
      true if the filename is valid, otherwise false

    • processImage

      public boolean processImage(String img, String user, String timestamp)
      Processes a single frame (image) from the video stream.
      The image is passed to the configured model for recognition, and the results are integrated into the user's StateMachine based on the preset's model.
      Parameters:
      img - a Base64-encoded string representing the image data
      user - the user identifier
      timestamp - the timestamp or frame identifier
      Returns:
      true if the image was processed successfully; false if the image data is empty
      See Also:
      • ImageSenderService.processImg(String, String, StateMachine, Map)

    • getProgress

      public Double getProgress(String user)
      Retrieves the current progress (0 to 1) of video processing for the given user.
      The progress is calculated as the ratio of processed frames to total frames.
      Parameters:
      user - the user identifier
      Returns:
      a double value representing the processing progress (0 = not started, 1 = completed)

    • getFileResponse

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getFileResponse(String user) throws MalformedURLException
      Returns the previously uploaded video file for download or streaming.
      If the file does not exist, a 404 (Not Found) response is returned.
      Parameters:
      user - the user identifier
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the video resource or a 404 error
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - if the file path cannot be converted to a valid URL

    • getUseImageSender

      public ImageSenderService getUseImageSender(String presetName)
      Retrieves the ImageSenderService being used based on the preset name.
      This is a convenience method for external clients that need direct access to the underlying image-sending implementation.
      Parameters:
      presetName - the name of the preset
      Returns:
      the corresponding ImageSenderService for that preset
